definition: coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: Hear the teacher say to start again for the money, I know it's spent his salary.
sentences.chinese: 听到老师说又要开始罚钱，我就知道是他工资花完了。

sentences.english: Or not return the library book and have to pay the fine.
sentences.chinese: 或者是，图书馆的书没还的话就要罚钱。

sentences.english: Most have paid if the smuggling of cotton, but also Faqian.
sentences.chinese: 大多数都要上交，如果走私棉花，还要罚钱。

sentences.english: Only if you wish to avoid paying by proving you are not at fault.
sentences.chinese: 除非你想不要罚钱，而去证明你没错。

sentences.english: If any screw of the school chair is missing, the student sitting on it will be fined.
sentences.chinese: 椅子上的螺丝钉如果不见了，学生是要被罚钱的。

sentences.english: You will get fined if you spit on the street.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在街上乱吐口水，你会被罚钱。

definition: to deduct marks (when grading school work)/to have marks deducted/penalty points/to lose points for a penalty or error
to break the rules/to violate regulations
to run a red light/failing to stop at a red traffic light/(slang) to have sex with a girl while she is menstruating
to suffer beating/fig. to be severely criticized/to take a hammering
to exceed the stipulated limit of a birth-control policy/to be reincarnated/to be lenient
